So said  tobemligado <jasbell@...>  on  2003-01-27
--------------------

>Because its IN THE CONSTRUCTOR, 

On its own, that doesn't matter. A class-level setX() method would do.
Not pretty, but it would do.

>...and my constructor does not take this 
>as a parameter because other several classes use it and access it 
>like this: ConfigManager.getInstance().

Another possibility would be ConfigManager.getInstance(directory),
where directory is an optional parameter. Not supplying it, you get the
default; otherwise, you get an instance for the supplied directory.

<snip />
